reviewerName: Bartok Kinski "A casual stroll through the lu...
reviewText: Mental Scars (2009) is absolutely pathetic. A high school drama club could produce a better movie. It looks like it was shot using a discontinued Video Camcorder. The lighting is terrible, and there are absolutely no production values. I can not iterate how bad this movie looks.The movie was terrible; acting, and film quality really stinks. I did not like it at all and feel this one was a waste of money. One of the worst low budget junkyard slasher films I have ever seen.DO NOT BUY THIS MOVIE.
Title: N/A

reviewText: ATTENTION AMAZON:I recently found out that this so called "V. Productions / Ron Allen" is none other than Richard Myles himself and that he goes around self promoting himself under aliases on various review boards and bashing his competition (see the scathing comments toward Chris .R. Notarile right here).Check out his reviews here on Amazon and you will see that in most cases, no matter what is being reviewed, it winds up being a glowing review of Richard Myles, his music or his movie "Mental Scars".Shame on you Richard Myles for misleading people and shame on you for all the hate toward Chris .R. Notarile as he was good enough to cast you in his fan film as Freddy Krueger.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Have you time to thrill? Check-out Mental Scars on DVD. This B-movie, this cinematic junkfood (set in a junkyard) offers all the goodies: gore, violence, salty dialogue, tacky make-up, semi-messy plot, semi-stale acting, and T&A. Add popcorn and beer to your viewing. Simply, the film should appeal to horror fans. Especially fans who appreciate admirable, skillful creativity exercised within certain budget constraints. I liked it.

reviewText: I am a BIG Sonny Landham fan, but now wish I had saved my money!  Think of the worset B movie you've ever seen, comparied to this one, it's a triple A movie! Landham dosent show up till last 20 min., and only one other actor even comes close to acting!  Wish I had known how bad it was, I would have saved my money!!!
summary: $8.98 is even to high to pay!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Dedra Lanucci has scammed a group of greedy investors to help her convert an old dilapidated junkyard into a profitable parking lot near a seedy liquor store and strip club. These investors are unaware that the junkyard sits on top of a mass Native American burial ground and that they will soon find themselves greeted by a maniacal killer, David Taggart, who lives in the junkyard. He is known by his ancient tribe as the "Protector" a dark figure in the night who scavenges the grounds in search of human flesh. David will stop to no end to protect mother earth, avenge the atrocities of his ancestors, and quench his insatiable thirst to feed.My interest peaked when I seen the trailer for this new Indie slasher film from Viper Productions. Not only did it look like it had enough chills and thrills in it but the story on an old Indian burial ground being under a junkyard where the remaining Native American roams and kills anyone that dares to trespass really sounded like something different, a story that could have some real meat to it. Like any Independent film this had a limited budget to work with but you would never know it by watching the film, everything was top notch from the cinematography with it's vibrant colors to the acting and right down to line to the special effects and make-up. Everyone is looking for that new horror Icon and I think we might of all found him in David Taggart, this man gives new meaning to the word creepy and he is just as nasty as well, combine those two with a junkyard at night as his home and you got yourself a real treat for horror fans. Like I said before the story is original and intriguing with some nice turns along the way and a great twist at the end that nicely wraps up the film. Richard Myles and Mischa Perez have created an impressive debut and what is more impressive is Richard also had several roles to play in the film including the menacing David. The entire cast did a great job and the film contains the right amount of chills,gore and even some nudity for the guys to make any fan of horror buff happy. I hear there is a sequel in the works which is great news, a character like this one demands a repeat performance and with a little higher budget it could be even more special than this one was. I was surprised and pleased at what I seen here, Mental Scars is a refreshing new horror flick that demands to be seen by all fans of the genre.Released by R Squared Films**** Out Of *****
Title: N/A

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: Dedra Lanucci (Teresa Alexandria) plans on removing a car junk yard and replace it with a parking lot. A slasher with childhood flashbacks roams the cars and kills at will, day or night. There are also some very white Native Americans who fit into this thing in order to make the plot inane.The film is low budget and is plagued with awkward plot filler scenes caused by poor writing. The acting was bad. Teresa Alexandria almost had a good line...just kidding. How does a fat white guy get to play an old Native American? The sound quality could have been better and some of the movie looked like it was filmed with Super VHS. The blood dripping from the wrench looked like transmission fluid, and most likely was. The film has some camp value especially at the end when the plot is explained and a guy says what I was thinking in comparing a junk yard to a parking lot.Parental Guide: F-bomb, sex, nudity (Teresa Alexandria).
Title: N/A

reviewText: I work at Victor Productions, and we have a new film called "That Darn Bill" check it out, cannot afford to shoot on 35mm, but ok, this review isn't about our films, so let me stop lol!Watched Mental Scars last night. The film was very intense, scary, creepy, and scored with one of the best music sound tracks I have heard in a long time. Coincidentally, I bought Mental Scars, Beyond Remedy, Bleed with Me, and last and least Methodic.  First thing, Amazon should definitely investigate these phony reviews from cast and crew who give their films golden 5 awards. Bleed with me marketed the gore well, but very LOW budget, and Methodic and Promise---do I really have to go there....but I will...they are the epitome of GARBAGE...terrible acting, low went camera, NO lighting, Walmart special production value, and the mask on the killer with the smily face, ARE you serious...? I promise not to ever watch Promise again, I fell asleep the first 10 minutes. At least "Bleed with me" it had a few good casts, and was semi-interesting. Whenever you see a new released film being sold as used here on Amazon after it just got released is NEVER a good sign, so yes, I am selling my videos Methodic, Promise, and Bleed with Me asap on ebay or something, I have to be creative in how to get rid of  them lol. Beyond Remedy like Mental Scars are real films, with real talent,  real potential, and shot on 35mm! The looks of Mental Scars looks so rich in color, that you forget it is a horror film on a tight budget. I think they could have used better tittle cards though! The sound effects and score was one of the best I have heard, VERY atmospheric and dark---it just penetrates you as your listening!I am a fan of  the horror genre and have been reviewing these flicks for 17 years. So I would think after all these years I have some credibility. Mental Scars stars Richard Myles, the killer in the night guarding his sacred Native American soil much like his sanctuary. At first, I was NOT in favor of a Native American exploitation film because of the pain America has placed on our people. I am part Native American, so this film's back story kind felt like revenge of my people. I give accolades to Richard for telling a story that at least Cherokee Native AMericans can relate to. Sonny has always been viewed as the all American Native American actor, but there are others who are just as influential as Sonny. Sonny does NOT represent us, sorry! Its sad, but many of my people have become mainstream and forgot what atrocities our people endured over the centuries, so yes Mental Scars had more meaning to our family besides the evil facet.I thank the producers for making Mental Scars, even though it is NOT suitable for children because of the brutality, and we are not cannibals, but what sells here is REVENGE. We really enjoyed the killer David Taggart and that strong 80s film. After seeing Michael Berryman this year at the Monster Mania Convention promoting Mental Scars, I asked him about the flick, and he loved it, he said he knew the producers and director of Mental Scars, so we just had to see what the fuss was all about. Mental Scars will become a true classic, it really captures the 80s slasher films to a "T" which I was sooooo disappointed with Hatchet. They had a great concept, but it was just not a good movie, Mental Scars shines above that film because the killer is new, the setting is semi-orginal,  and the score was on par with the best. The only thing I did not like is some of the workers in the junkyard were not good actors like the guy taking a piss with the red shirt...I could not understand his line, oh and the story was hard to follow in the beginning until the end. Dedra was HOT! she looks better with her cloths off than on (he he he). She was also a very strong actress in this film, kind of fun to watch. The film shows behind the scenes which was interesting, but you should have had the love making behind the scenes on it---come on this is AMERICA!So I would recommend Mental Scars--ABSOLUTELY(for adults) for children ABSOLUTELY NOT. Does it have production value ABSOLUTELY, does accomplish the 80s flavor ABSOLUTELY, is it scary ABSOLUTELY, does it give you nightmares ABSOLUTELY, should there be a sequel ABSOLUTELY, would I want Taggart in my family tree ABSOLUTELY NOT-- LOL! WOULD LIKE TO HAVE DEDRA FOR ONE NIGHT---ABSOLUTELY!DOES MENTAL SCARS LIVE UP TO ITS HYPE---MY COMMENTS SPEAKS FOR ITSELF :)Would I recommend this movie, you bet'cha  4.5 out of 5
Title: N/A
